intro: Gilia ochroleuca subsp. transmontana, commonly known as the Transmontana gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces elongated seed pods that split open to release its seeds. This subspecies is often found in California and adjacent regions, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained conditions.
